snippet: As part of a plea agreement, Mr. Schwab, 83, admitted he failed to file state tax returns on his personal income for six years, but said he did not know he had to file returns for his businesses.
abstract: Philip B Schwab, demolition contractor on trial in Manhattan for tax evasion, admits as part of plea agreement that he failed to file state tax returns on his personal income for six years, but says he did not know he had to file returns for his businesses.
lead_paragraph: As part of a plea agreement, Mr. Schwab, 83, admitted he failed to file state tax returns on his personal income for six years, but said he did not know he had to file returns for his businesses.

headline.seo: Philip Schwab, Demolition Contractor, Pleads Guilty to Tax Charge
headline.main: Contractor Pleads Guilty to One of Many Tax Charges
headline.print_headline: Contractor Pleads Guilty To One of Many Tax Charges
